alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:15PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Alpine, Placer, El Dorado, southern Washoe, and Douglas Counties and western Carson City through 500 PM PDT... At 413 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Zephyr Cove, or near South Lake Tahoe, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carson City, South Lake Tahoe, Dagget Pass, Spooner Summit, Bliss State Park, Meyers, Kingsbury, Glenbrook, Zephyr Cove, Emerald Bay, Genoa, Zephyr Cove-Round Hill Village, South Lake Tahoe Airport, Stateline, Heavenly Valley, Meeks Bay, Fallen Leaf Campground and Meeks Bay Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near Lake Tahoe, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
